title: 32. What is a Good Death — and Why Do So Few of Us Get One?
description: When it comes to end-of-life medical care, getting it right can be hard — even for doctors.  Bapu Jena discusses surprising research on how we can live better - and maybe longer - before we die.
author: bapu@freakonomics.com (Freakonomics Radio + Stitcher)
content:encoded: When it comes to end-of-life medical care, getting it right can be hard — even for doctors.  Bapu Jena discusses surprising research on how we can live better - and maybe longer - before we die.
